report_text: history and physical **institution **place, pa **zip-code **name[aaa, bbb m] **id-num **id-num a5a/1 date: **date[mar 08 06] service of: **name[zzz] **name[yyy] chief complaint chest pain. history of present illness this is one of several **street-address. **institution admissions for this **age[in 40s]-year-old white female with a history of morbid obesity, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and asthma. patient states that she was in her usual state of health until two days prior to this admission. she was in an argument with her boss at work at **institution and she developed the gradual onset of a sharp stabbing retrosternal chest pain which radiated into her right arm. she said there are no aggravating factors. she did have some slight nausea. she denied any shortness of breath, diaphoresis, or palpitations. she was admitted through the emergency room to rule out an acute coronary event. her ekg was normal in the emergency room. her troponin i levels were negative. her cbc showed a slightly elevated white count of 16.2 with 14 bands. the chest x-ray was pending at the time of this dictation. past medical history 1. hypertension. 2. hyperlipidemia. 3. asthma. 4. morbid obesity. allergies tetracycline causes mouth ulcers. medications 1. zestril 20 mg p.o. daily. 2. lasix 10 mg p.o. b.i.d. 3. vicodin as needed for chronic back pain. 4. baby aspirin 1 tablet daily. 5. albuterol inhaler as needed. past surgical history 1. l4-l5 laminotomy and a discectomy of l4-l5 in **date[sep 2006]. 2. tubal ligation. 3. cholecystectomy. 4. operation on right foot for plantar fascitis. social history no smoking. social alcohol usage. no illicit drug usage. patient is married and has two children. she is a delicatessen manager at **institution. family history she has one brother age **age[in 30s] years old who is alive and well and who has also had back surgery. father is **age[in 70s] years old and had a stroke, coronary artery disease, hypertension, and melanoma of the face. mother is **age[in 70s] years old and has copd and hypertension. review of systems her review of systems is otherwise unremarkable, except eyes - she has farsightedness and wears glasses. musculoskeletal is positive for intermittent low back pain. physical examination vital signs: temperature 37.1, heart rate 97, respiration 20, blood pressure 133/85. general: alert, obese white female complaining of intermittent chest pain. heent: within normal limits. neck: within normal limits. lungs: clear. heart: regular rate and rhythm without murmurs, rubs, or gallops. abdomen: obese, soft, and nontender. no organomegaly or masses. back: nontender. she has several healed scars. extremities: within normal limits. breast/pelvic/rectal: deferred. impression 1. atypical chest pain. 2. fever, possible viral syndrome. 3. hypertension. 4. hyperlipidemia. 5. asthma in remission. 6. morbid obesity. plan check chest x-ray. check blood cultures. a thallium stress test has been ordered. if it is negative, we will discharge the patient. if it is positive, we will admit her and get a cardiology consultation.
